DOC.brief_summary: The objective study compare bronchodilator efficacy tiotropium inhalation via DISCAIR ( 18 mcg daily ) SPIRIVA HANDIHALER® ( 18 mcg daily ) patient moderate severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD ) .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison 24 Hour Bronchodilator Efficacy Tiotropium 18 mcg Delivered Via DISCAIR Versus SPIRIVA 18 µg Delivered Via HANDIHALER® Patients With Moderate Severe COPD
DOC.criteria: Patients age 40 year old moderate severe COPD diagnosis Current/former smoker least 10 packyear history cigarette smoking Patients establish clinical COPD severity define postbroncodilator FEV1/FVC ratio ≤0.70 FEV1 ≤80 % predict normal screening Females nonchild bear potential female child bear potential negative pregnancy test ; acceptable contraceptive method Have excacerbation within last 4 week Hava capability communicate investigator Accept adapt procedure study protocol Signed date informed consent History hypersensitivity anticholinergic Diagnosis asthma History alergic rinit athopy Current history lung cancer Known symptomatic prostatic hypertrophy require drug therapy Known narrowangle glaucoma require drug therapy Have experience exacerbation COPD low respiratory inflammatory disease require use antibiotic , oral parenteral corticosteroid ( CS ) within 4 week prior screen visit and/or runin period Patients vaccinate poored virüs vaccinate within 2 week prior screen visit and/or runin period Patients recent history myocardial infarction , acute ischemic cardiac disease severe cardiac arrhythmia require drug therapy Women pregnant lactate plan become pregnant study
